{"step_by_step_thinking": "C-factor, or configuration factor, is a term used in dentistry. It refers to the ratio of bonded to unbonded surfaces in a dental restoration. This factor is particularly important when dealing with composite restorations, as it can influence the amount of polymerisation shrinkage stress. It is not related to condensing force for amalgam, cavity preparation for amalgam, or root curvature.", "answer_choice": "D"}
